paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses a case of Atelosteogenesis Type I and mentions a splice site mutation in the BRCA2 gene, but does not provide detailed penetrance data or individual records.

functional_data.summary: The splice site mutation was classified by the ACMG guidelines as pathogenic and associated with breast and ovarian cancers.

variants.population_frequency: present in only one control of our Brazilian database (ABraOM)
variants.evidence_level: probable pathogenicity, not related to proband phenotype
variants.additional_notes: Despite its pathogenic classification, it is not relevant to the phenotype of the proband.
key_quotes: The splice site mutation was in the BRCA2 (c.8488–1G > A) gene, and it was present in only one control of our Brazilian database (ABraOM).
It was classified by the ACMG guidelines as pathogenic and associated with breast and ovarian cancers.

extraction_metadata.notes: Only one variant in the BRCA2 gene was found, with limited penetrance data.
